summary: Cap Clicker: a beginner-friendly incremental/clicker game where players earn caps by clicking, then spend caps on upgrades to increase caps per click and generate caps automatically over time.
architectural_notes: Motion/visual effects (e.g., smooth scroll, motion blur) should respect reduced-motion accessibility preferences.

existing_features.title: Implement the core clicker loop: render a prominent "Click" button that awards caps when pressed, track total caps, and display the current caps total and caps-per-click in the main game view.

Add an upgrade shop that allows spending caps on upgrades that increase caps earned per click. Each upgrade must have a name, description, current level (or owned count), current cost, and the effect it provides.
Add automation/idle upgrades that generate caps over time (caps per second). Implement a timer-based cap accrual loop and display current caps-per-second in the UI.

Create a simple, beginner-friendly game layout with clear progression feedback: a main play area (caps total + click button), a stats panel (caps-per-click and caps-per-second), and a shop panel (upgrades). Provide subtle feedback on clicks and purchases (e.g., button press animation and/or small floating number).
Choose and apply a cohesive visual theme for Cap Clicker (colors, typography, layout style) and enforce it consistently across the main game view and shop. Do not use a blue/purple dominant palette.
Add generated static image assets for the game (iconography/background) and reference them from the UI via the frontend public assets folder.

Expand the upgrade shop inventory to provide about 10 total upgrade options (across click and automation upgrades) by adding additional upgrade definitions, each with a unique id, name, description, baseCost, costScaling, effectPerLevel, and type, while keeping progression/balance sensible from early to late game.

Do a UI/visual polish pass on the main game screen to make the design feel more premium and cohesive, while keeping the existing warm amber/orange theme (no blue/purple-dominant palette). Focus on clearer hierarchy, spacing, typography scale, and consistent surface styling across the Stats panel, Click button area, and both shop panels.

Improve the shop UI/UX styling and readability for upgrade browsing and purchasing (Click Upgrades and Automation), including scroll-area presentation, section clarity, and upgrade state clarity (affordable vs unaffordable vs just purchased).

Enhance moment-to-moment game feel through improved micro-interactions: refine click button press feedback and floating +caps feedback animation to feel smoother and more satisfying, while respecting reduced-motion preferences.

Make the UI more accessible and robust: ensure keyboard navigability for core actions (click button and Buy buttons), visible focus states, and sufficient contrast for text on translucent backgrounds.

Increase the size and hit area of the primary click target (the main "CLICK!" button) so it is noticeably bigger and easier to click/tap on both desktop and mobile, without breaking the existing centered layout.
Add smooth scrolling behavior for the gameâ€™s scrollable shop areas (the two ScrollArea lists) so mouse wheel/trackpad scrolling feels smooth and not jumpy.
Add a fast-mouse-movement blur effect so that when the pointer moves quickly, a subtle motion blur/trail effect appears, and it fades away when the pointer slows down or stops.

Update the app footer in the main game view to include a closing credit line that says "Made by Anuj" (English text), placed at the end of the footer so it appears as the last credit shown on the page.

new_feature_requests.summary: Core clicker loop: a button click awards caps (main currency) and displays increasing totals
Upgrade system to spend caps on improvements (e.g., increased caps per click)
Automation upgrades that generate caps over time (idle/auto income)
Expand the upgrade shop to include more upgrade options (target ~10 total upgrades)
Improve the game's visual design/UI to look good (overall layout, styling, and polish)
Increase the size of the main click/tap target (make the primary click area/button bigger and easier to hit)
Add smooth scrolling behavior for scrollable shop/content areas
Add a fast-mouse-movement motion blur effect (mouse blur when cursor moves quickly)
Add an end/closing credit text (e.g., "Made by Anuj") somewhere appropriate in the app (such as a footer/about/credits area)
